summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to American Express, dated June 29, 2020, demanding financial records for accounts associated with Ghislaine Maxwell from November 1, 2019 onward. The document includes a cover letter requesting non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation and a rider specifying the records required.

persons.name: Aurey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena and cover letter as the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, requesting financial records from American Express related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the individual associated with the American Express account for which financial records are being subpoenaed as part of a federal grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Strauss, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena for Maxwell's financial records as part of a grand jury investigation.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to American Express for financial records associated with Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Subpoena Return Date
events.description: The date by which American Express is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
American Express, 43 Butterfield Circle, El Paso, TX 79906-5202
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to American Express on June 29, 2020, seeking extensive financial records for accounts associated with Ghislaine Maxwell from November 1, 2019, onward.
The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations, including 18 U.S.C. ยง 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that American Express voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The requested records include account statements, applications, deposit/withdrawal items, wire transfers, correspondence, and internal memoranda related to the accounts.
The document indicates an ongoing, time-sensitive investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's financial activities by the Southern District of New York.
